intro: Ilex macropoda var. pseudomacropoda, commonly known as the Mexican evergreen holly, is a shrub or small tree native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its dense, spiny foliage and small, dark berries. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full shade. Its leaves are leathery, elliptical, and have a glossy appearance, while its flowers are small and greenish-white. This variety is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive form and seasonal interest.
